IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a service box on one of our electricity poles that needs replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. Our engineers will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place on Highams Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place in the Layer Road area.

This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Cavick Road.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 00:56 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Damask Green Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have diverted power around.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Talie at 00:40 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 18:28 - We can now confirm that all power in the Wedmore Street area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted as much power as they can. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used a temporary generator to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Donny at 18:23 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that the water board have been able to temporarily isolate water supplies so we can carry out repairs to the underground network. Engineers ware now in the process of carrying these out, along with connecting a temporary generator to restore power. To allow time for this, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 19:00 and 20:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are are waiting for the water board to complete repairs to a leaking water main before they can proceed with our own repairs to the underground cable fault.

With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Kevin at 17:31.

We're sorry your power has now been off for several hours and we're working as quickly as possible to get you back on.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.

Sent by Theo at 20:24 - We can now confirm that all power in the Limpsfield Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 19:33
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Limpsfield Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 22:30 and 23:30; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Theo at 19:22.

This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 19:33

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 20:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Park Lane area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 00:00-01:00 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Donny at 21:04.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 00:00-01:00, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on an underground electricity cable affecting the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Adam at 04:43 - We can now confirm that all power in the Strone Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground network fault, which our engineers diverted power around.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Our team of specialist engineers have now begun to arrive on site to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Adam at 03:36.

Sent by Adam at 03:09 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers.

Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair.

We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change.

For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 07:23 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is faulty overhead electrical equipment affecting 444 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 09:30 and 10:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 09:30 and 10:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.

What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
